SEARCH
Module org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi
Package org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi

Class AFUNIXNaming

java.lang.Object
org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi.AFNaming
org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi.AFUNIXNaming
public final class AFUNIXNaming extends AFNaming
The AFUNIXSocket-compatible equivalent of Naming. Use this class for accessing RMI registries that are reachable by AFUNIXSockets.
Author:
Christian Kohlsch√ºtter

  • Method Details

    • getDefaultSocketDirectory

      public static File getDefaultSocketDirectory()
      Returns the directory where RMI sockets are stored by default. You can configure this location by setting the System property org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi.socketdir upon start.
      Returns:
      The directory.

    • newPrivateInstance

      public static AFUNIXNaming newPrivateInstance() throws IOException
      Returns a new private instance that resides in a custom location, to avoid any collisions with existing instances.
      Returns:
      The private AFNaming instance.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the operation fails.

    • getInstance

      public static AFUNIXNaming getInstance() throws IOException
      Returns the default instance of AFUNIXNaming. Sockets are stored in java.io.tmpdir.
      Returns:
      The default instance.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the operation fails.

    • getInstance

      public static AFUNIXNaming getInstance(File socketDir) throws RemoteException
      Returns a AFUNIXNaming instance which support several socket files that can be stored under the same, given directory.
      Parameters:
      socketDir - The directory to store sockets in.
      Returns:
      The instance.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the operation fails.

    • getInstance

      public static AFUNIXNaming getInstance(File socketDir, int registryPort) throws RemoteException
      Returns a AFUNIXNaming instance which support several socket files that can be stored under the same, given directory. A custom "registry port" can be specified. Typically, AF-UNIX specific ports should be above 100000.
      Parameters:
      socketDir - The directory to store sockets in.
      registryPort - The registry port. Should be above 100000.
      Returns:
      The instance.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the operation fails.

    • getInstance

      public static AFUNIXNaming getInstance(File socketDir, int registryPort, String socketPrefix, String socketSuffix) throws RemoteException
      Returns a AFUNIXNaming instance which support several socket files that can be stored under the same, given directory. A custom "registry port" can be specified. Typically, AF-UNIX specific ports should be above 100000.
      Parameters:
      socketDir - The directory to store sockets in.
      registryPort - The registry port. Should be above 100000.
      socketPrefix - A string to be inserted at the beginning of each socket filename, or null.
      socketSuffix - A string to be added at the end of each socket filename, or null.
      Returns:
      The instance.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the operation fails.

    • getSingleFileInstance

      public static AFNaming getSingleFileInstance(File socketFile) throws IOException
      Returns an AFUNIXNaming instance which only supports one file. (Probably only useful when you want/can access the exported UnicastRemoteObject directly)
      Parameters:
      socketFile - The socket file.
      Returns:
      The instance.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the operation fails.

      Description copied from class: AFNaming

    • getRegistry

      public AFRegistry getRegistry() throws RemoteException
      Returns a reference to the existing RMI registry. If there's no registry running at this port, an exception is thrown.
      Overrides:
      getRegistry in class AFNaming
      Returns:
      The registry.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If there was a problem.

    • getRegistry

      public AFUNIXRegistry getRegistry(long timeout, TimeUnit unit) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from class: AFNaming
      Returns a reference to the existing RMI registry. If there's no registry running at this port after waiting for up to the given time, an exception is thrown.
      Overrides:
      getRegistry in class AFNaming
      Parameters:
      timeout - The timeout value.
      unit - The timeout unit.
      Returns:
      The registry.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If there was a problem.

    • getRegistry

      public AFUNIXRegistry getRegistry(boolean create) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from class: AFNaming
      Returns a reference to the RMI registry, or null. If there's no registry running at this port, and create is set to true, a new one is created; when create is set to false, null is returned.
      Overrides:
      getRegistry in class AFNaming
      Parameters:
      create - true if a new register may be created if necessary.
      Returns:
      The registry, or null
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If there was a problem.

    • createRegistry

      public AFUNIXRegistry createRegistry() throws RemoteException
      Description copied from class: AFNaming
      Creates a new RMI Registry. If there already was a registry created previously, it is shut down and replaced by the current one. Use AFNaming.getRegistry() to try to reuse an existing registry.
      Overrides:
      createRegistry in class AFNaming
      Returns:
      The registry
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the operation fails.
      See Also:
      • AFNaming.getRegistry()

    • getRegistrySocketFile

      public File getRegistrySocketFile()
      Returns the socket file which is used to control the RMI registry. The file is usually in the directory returned by getRegistrySocketDir().
      Returns:
      The directory.

    • list

      public String[] list() throws RemoteException, AccessException
      Convenience method for getRegistry().list. Unlike AFRegistry.list(), in case the registry has been shut down already, an empty array is returned.
      Returns:
      an array of the names bound in this registry
      Throws:
      RemoteException - upon error
      AccessException - upon error
